Description: Studies of a bronze mummy-case for a mummified cat, (from Bubastis circa 500 BC); five studies of feline head, seen from different angles Metalpoint (probably silverpoint) on pink prepared paper
Curator's comments: The example drawn by Legros may have been that in the Department of Ancient Egypt and Sudan at the British Museum (EA 35854), which is dated to circa 664-305 BC. This example was probably acquired by the Museum in the 19th century, and although it once had the 'Old Collection' number 270 it is not possible to give a more precise date of acquisition (information from John Taylor, Department of Ancient Egypt and Sudan, January 2003 ). Though usually a studio practice Legros did execute metalpoint drawings in front of the motif, particularly when copying from Old Master paintings in museums and art galleries (information from Timothy Wilcox 2002).
Exhibition history: 2015 10 Sep-6 Dec, London, British Museum, 'Drawing in Silver and Gold'
Acquisition name: Donated by: Guy J F Knowles
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Charles Julius Knowles (Knowles Collection No.25)
Acquisition notes: 1953,0422.1 to 14 are all by Alphonse Legros, and all come from the collection of the donor's father, C.J.Knowles (d.1900), who was a friend of the artist.
